intro: Ononis pseudoserotina, commonly known as the false serotina, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three oval to lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its fruit is a legume pod that splits open to release small, kidney-shaped seeds. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils in Mediterranean and temperate regions.
